result.execSummary:
The defendant David Samuel Clausing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
- Court sets restitution at $0.
- Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defend

- No contact with victim.
- No weapons.

- Complete a batter intervention program.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Comply with any treatment recommended by the agent.
- Provide a DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: With 4 DAYS credit.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Court sets restitution at $0.
- Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Samuel Clausing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Samuel Clausing appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty appeared by video for David Samuel Clausing.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, Huber Privileges for work and treatment.  

AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant ordered to serve 4 DAYS in the House of Correction, with 4 DAYS credit.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNT 2: Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Complete a batter intervention program.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Comply with any treatment recommended by the agent.
- No contact with victim.
- No weapons.
- Court sets restitution at $0.
- Provide a DNA sample. 

- Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Defendant David Samuel Clausing appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty appeared by video for David Samuel Clausing.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant David Samuel Clausing in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for David Samuel Clausing.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Due to court calendar congestion, Court adjourns the matter for a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant David Samuel Clausing in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appear via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM.   Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 35.  **Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant David Samuel Clausing in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David Samuel Clausing in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant David Samuel Clausing in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant David Samuel Clausing in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
